title: Customize Your iPhone with Unique App Launch Sound Effects
description: There are plenty of ways to personalize your iPhone or iPad, right down to how it responds when you open an app. With a quick setup, you can have it play a custom sound every time you launch your favorite apps, adding a unique touch to your daily routine. Apple's Shortcuts app makes it easy to automate tasks, including playing a custom sound whenever you launch an app. Whether you want a nostalgic startup chime, a sci-fi beep, or a voice clip announcing each app, this feature adds a unique touch to your iPhone or iPad experience. Once set up, your iPhone or iPad will automatically play the assigned sound every time you open the selected app — no extra taps required. RequirementsiPhone or iPad running the latest iOS or iPadOS version Shortcuts app (preinstalled) A sound effect (either a system-based one or a custom file) Start a new personal 'App' automationLaunch the Shortcuts app on your iPhone or iPad. This is where you'll create an automation that plays a sound whenever you open a...more

title: Safari on iPhone Finally Lets You Check a Site's Security — Here's How to Verify SSL/TLS Certificates
description: In an era where cybersecurity threats are constantly evolving, knowing whether a website is secure is more important than ever. Apple has finally addressed a long-standing limitation in Safari for iPhone and iPad, allowing us to view SSL/TLS certificate details in iOS 18.4 and iPadOS 18.4 — something we could already do on macOS for over a decade. A long-awaited feature for Safari on iOS and iPadOSUntil now, Safari on iPhone and iPad lacked a way to inspect a website's security certificate beyond the simple lock icon in the address bar. This meant you couldn't access detailed insights into a site's security — something that browsers like Chrome and Firefox have long provided. Even Safari on Mac has supported certificate lookup for over a decade. With iOS 18.4 and iPadOS 18.4, Apple introduces a long-awaited feature that finally lets us see in-depth security details of a website's connection directly within Safari. This update is a significant step forward in improving transparency and...more
